featured.text: Picking up on teens' interest in computer games, Hilfiger sponsored a Nintendo competition and installed Nintendo terminals in his stores.
After all, a brain is not a computer.
It replays the image back through the glasses after processing it on an attached computer.
Future bank robbers will not need explosives to blow open bank safes—all they will need is someone who can break computer codes.
John has been working at the computer for twenty-four hours.

other.text: Nowadays students can information from a variety of sources, such as computers, television, and compact discs.
As computers are getting less expensive, they are _______ used in schools and offices today.
John should ______ more often with his friends and family after work, instead of staying in his room to play computer games.
You don't even need a very expensive computer—but you must understand everything about all kinds of computers.
Julie wants to buy a ______ computer so that she can carry it around when she travels.
Jack made a(n)______ payment on the new computer because he did not have enough money for it.
According to the passage, breaking into computer codes of banks, large companies, and government departments is (A) a widespread criminal practice.
Dead mail will also be listed on a computer so that people can call in and check to see if a missing item is there.
Today, CGI (computer generated imagery) is widely used in filmmaking, and it is now 29 to create very lifelike scenes without using real stunt people.
Finding out which college suits you involves time and energy, but ___(25)___ more than those you might spend on buying a motorcycle or a computer.
The memory _____ of the new computer has been increased so that more information can be stored.
After working in front of my computer for the entire day, my neck and shoulders got so that I couldn’t even turn my head.
But how long will it be before criminal gangs, like the Mafia, start to use computer experts to help them in their crimes?
Next, we sold the computers off to Stab, Grab, Grit, and Nasty, a firm of lawyers nearby.
This new computer is obviously _____ to the old one because it has many new functions.
Already in Britain people say that computer crimes are costing companies between 500 million pounds and 2.5 billion pounds a year.
It's your brain against the computer.
Based on the passage, in order to break into computer codes, one needs (A) an elaborate and expensive multi-media computer.

definition.zh_def: 計算機；一種能夠執行計算和處理數據的電子設備。
definition.en_def: A device that can perform calculations and process data electronically.
definition.example: I use my computer to complete my homework.
